messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Digest Number 1235
messages.msgSnippet: ... While I think list members would enjoy this movie, it really in many ways is a cheezy kids flick. There are at least three of them. ... This is a truly
messages.messageBody:
>6)Daimajin-a great samurai film all on its own, AND you get one of
>the most convincing Japanese giant monsters too!
>
While I think list members would enjoy this movie, it really in many
ways is a cheezy kids flick. There are at least three of them.

>7)Hanzo The Razor:The Snare-a great break from the tired genre of
>noble ronin films. The Hanzo films work as drama, parody, comedy and
>chambara.
>
This is a truly bizarre film, I do think list members will enjoy it,
just don't let your 'gaki' watch it.

>And for best Taiga drama-Toshiie & Matsu. OK, it's a `chick' Taiga
>drama, but Toshiie is such an engaging goof and Matsu is just plain
>adorable.
>
>
What about Musashi? Still T&M was much better than Shinsengumi.

Other films about historical characters that I think are fun are Onmyoji
and one of the cheesiest ninja flicks, Sudden Death!

Jim Eckman
